results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part two, conductor Verdon Williams discusses the tasks that a conductor must do before each performance - choosing the number and type of instruments needed; studying the melody and style of the music. Shows him rehearsing an orchestra and a choir.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson

results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part one, conductor Verdon Williams discusses his role within the orchestra, use of the baton to keep rhythm; different kinds of rhythms; emphasising staccatto, accents; bringing in new instruments; starting and finishing each movement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson

results.title: The Conciliation by Benjamin Duterrau, 1840
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye II”.
This film looks at the works of Benjamin Duterrau, and in particular his painting “The Conciliation”. This was of importance as, based on the meeting of George Augustus Robinson in 1830 with a group of Tasmanian aborigines, it was the first painting of a historical scene created in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, David Muir, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Film Australia

results.title: The Concept and principles of functional drafting
results.creator_credit: Majestic Motion Pictures and Industrial Education Films
results.brief_description: This film is designed to demonstrate to the new person “on the board” as well as the experienced draftsman or designer, what functional drafting can do, mentioning saving in time and cost and improvement in actual drawings. Points out the advantages and some examples of functional drafting. States the basic principles involved in this simplified form of drafting.

results.title: The Compleat schooling
results.creator_credit: David H. Fowler, New Zealand National Film Unit and Rupert Glover
results.brief_description: Freyberg Memorial School, in Te Atatu, near Auckland, has become an important community centre. Teachers and parents have extended the school’s function to make it an exciting place where adults and youngsters are involved in many activities outside the mainstream of education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David H. Fowler, New Zealand National Film Unit and Rupert Glover

results.title: The Competitive Edge
results.brief_description: A study of Victoria’s economic strategy for growth which singles out areas of competitive strength. The nine areas selected for government support include: 1)industrial skills; 2)commercial centre; 3)research capability; 4)brown coal; 5)off shore oil; 6)agriculture; 7)location centrality; 8)national role as cultural and commercial centre; 9)tourism.

results.title: The Compenius Organ in Denmark
results.creator_credit: Dansk Kulturfilm, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Christen Jul
results.brief_description: At Frederiksborg Palace is the famous organ constructed in wood by Esaias Compenius of Brunswick. Kept in working order since 1610, it is a living witness to the love of music which enriched the reign of Christian IV. In the film, the music of Buxtehude (who had considerable influence on J.S. Bach) brings out many of its unique beauties. Tapestries by Hans Kneiper, included in the film, illustrate daily life of the 17th century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dansk Kulturfilm, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Christen Jul

results.title: The Company of officer cadets
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Artransa Park Studios and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: A career as an Army Officer is one which might not normally occur to a young man choosing his future profession. The busy life of young men at one of Australia’s officer-training schools where, behind the parades, formal social functions and tradition, there is difficult and demanding study to train men for battle and for times of national disaster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Artransa Park Studios and Phillip Mark-Law

results.title: The Company computers and the unions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Systems Organisation the Management of Complexity”.
This film was made at the Pearl Assurance Company where recent developments in office technology, specifically microcomputers, is beginning to have a dramatic impact on the kinds of work that the staff at Pearl produce.
